snippet: An agreement to purchase four opera productions from the Salzburg Festival, without approval from the opera house’s board or Italian authorities, has turned into a scandal in Milan.
abstract: Alexander Pereira, incoming general manager of La Scala, has raised controversy by agreeing to buy four productions from the Salzburg Festival without approval from the opera house's board of Italian authorities.

byline.original: By GAIA PIANIGIANI and REBECCA SCHMID
byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani reported from Rome and Rebecca Schmid from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: An agreement to purchase four opera productions from the Salzburg Festival, without approval from the opera house’s board or Italian authorities, has turned into a scandal in Milan.

headline.main: Deals by the Incoming La Scala Chief Cause a Stir
headline.print_headline: Deals by the Incoming La Scala Chief Cause a Stir
